text: <!channel>: Good morning! Virtual stand-up this morning, please. (I'm wfh this morning, but will be in the office mid-day)
sat in the flipflop session all day. monitoring to see where i can help. no actions planned by me.

Updates from me: After much discussion with the client yesterday, we settled on prioritization for stretch goals. Top priority is the idea of a pinching measurement tool, in addition to 1:1 photos that can be displayed from the video. The UI would need to handle this content as "bonus material" on the side rather than trying to integrate into the video playback and create a complicated system for playback of video + pushed content. First step is that evans will spend some time over the holidays to verify from a technical perspective.

• Thinking about all that happened yesterday. 
• Trying to figure out the go forward plan for design team
• Mostly think it means we stay the course — Finalize burner controls, move on to simple video record/playback, investigate cooking tools

12 days of active design/development left, so I want to make sure everyone has a clear path forward and the tools they need to keep moving. What are the pain points? How often are people waiting for the rig? Do we need some sessions to break down bigger tasks into smaller ones?
Update from me:
rig waiting issue is fixed
hand tracking is solid, working on clicks right now, mostly working right
will get video export buttoned up now that we can share the camera
audio capture is basically working - will merge with video once that's solid
<<EOF
Yesterday I worked on an issue we're having where one pan is sometimes falsely identified as another. Will continue to work on that today.
Update from me: Planning to spend as much time as possible with the rig to work on rendering bugs, delays, browser setup. Will also continue working on main controls and until click is good to go.
When clicks and video are in a good place, I'll work on integrating them with node
sounds good
I'm getting close to finishing burner control UI with timer UI.
<@U02618EV1> let's do some system profiling while you're on the rig, get your hardware resources dialed in
OK
<@U02618EV1> do you have a canvas with just the grey bubbles for testing touch? would be handy to plumb that in with the click code while we get the events dialed in
Not sure I understand.
n/m - I'll swing by and chat f2f
K

<!channel>, especially <@U02618EV1>: Final Design PDFs (and illustrator files) are on the NAS. Clients > Samsung > Luxo > Design.

1.1 System Intro
2.1 Burner Control (Temp)
2.2 Burner Control (Timer)
2.3 Burner Control (Movement / Residual Heat)

Feel free to review & ask questions should you have any.
<@U026PLK4S> Do "hot surfaces" have a specific/static location or do they move around?
Hot surfaces are residual, after you move the pan.
then fade out pretty quickly, (2-5 sec)
they are under the "stretch line"
Sorry, what is the "stretch line?"

on our trello board, we have items that we've committed to, and things we've indicated are stretch goals. Showing residual hot surfaces is a stretch goal. My understanding is that it's not a particularly difficult one (unlike some of the others!), so if we can include it, great. But it's also not a high priority for them, so doesn't need to be prioritized.
Thanks.
